_header: Why love you so much how may this be
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, a roundel, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 42) — 14 lines

BLHar682.First Lines:
WHi loue y yow so moche how may þis beAnd hate so moche myn
                    hert þis wold y lere…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Which recchith not to doon me displesereNor of my dewryng
                    long aduersite
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel.
